Compute Truncated‐L1 IRLS Estimate for Univariate GLM

Source: R/Rinternal.R
univariate_irls_glm.Rd

Fits a single‐covariate GLM using IRLS with a truncated‐L1 penalty. Solves: $$\min_\theta\;-\ell(\theta) \;+\;\lambda\,\min\bigl(1,|\theta|/\tau\bigr)$$ via iteratively reweighted least squares, with a closed‐form capped‐L1 update each step.

Arguments

x

Numeric vector of covariates (length n).

y

Numeric response vector (length n).

family

A stats::family object (e.g. gaussian(), binomial(), poisson()).

offset

Numeric scalar or vector (length n) giving the linear predictor offset.

lambda

Numeric penalty weight; if ≤0 defaults to \(\sqrt{2\log(n)/n}\).

tau

Numeric truncation parameter; if ≤0 uses grid {1/n,…,5/n} for n≤500 and 1/n otherwise.

max_iter

Integer. Maximum number of IRLS iterations.

tol

Numeric convergence tolerance for θ.

Value

Numeric scalar: the estimated coefficient \(\hat\theta\).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(42)
n <- 100
x <- rnorm(n)
# Gaussian example
y <- 2*x + rnorm(n)
univariate_irls_glm(x, y, gaussian(), offset=0,
                    lambda=0, tau=0, max_iter=25, tol=1e-8)
} # }
